title: Murray W. Stand
text: Murray W. Stand (1897May 17, 1956) was an American politician who served the <a href="New%20York%20City%27s%204th%20City%20Council%20district">4th district</a> of the <a href="New%20York%20City%20Board%20of%20Aldermen">New York City Board of Aldermen</a> during the 1920s and 1930s. The majority leader of the Board, he later became the Chairman of the <a href="1939%20New%20York%20World%27s%20Fair">World's Fair Commission</a> in 1937. He died of a heart attack on May 17, 1956, while attending a service at the Civic Center Synagogue.
